channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: These states are Harris' path to presidency. And, why the U.K. is rioting
item.description: Vice President Harris is expected to announce her running mate in the next few days. Her pick could help secure the presidential race. And, here's why the U.K. is rioting.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris is expected to announce her running mate in the next few days. Her pick could help secure the presidential race. And, here's why the U.K. is rioting.

(Image credit: Julia Beverly)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Bangladeshâ€™s army chief has announced the formation of an interim government
item.description: The announcement follows the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who had been in power for 15 years. Thousands of protesters had defied a military curfew and stormed her official residence.
item.content:encoded: The announcement follows the resignation of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who had been in power for 15 years. Thousands of protesters had defied a military curfew and stormed her official residence.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Simone Biles misses a medal in Olympic balance beam final, Italy's D'Amato takes gold
item.description: Monday's balance beam final saw Biles's first major mistake of these Olympic Games, a fall that cost her a podium spot. She has otherwise been transcendent in what may be her last Olympics ever.
item.content:encoded:
Monday's balance beam final saw Biles's first major mistake of these Olympic Games, a fall that cost her a podium spot. She has otherwise been transcendent in what may be her last Olympics ever.

(Image credit: Loic Venance)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: A network dubbed the internet of animals is helping track migrating critters
item.description: The internet of animals, it's a global initiative to tag, track and learn about animal movement around the world.
item.content:encoded: The internet of animals, it's a global initiative to tag, track and learn about animal movement around the world.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Fears are growing of a widening war in the Middle East
item.description: The Middle East is bracing for tit-for-tat responses between Iran and Israel that could spin out into an all-out regional war.
item.content:encoded: The Middle East is bracing for tit-for-tat responses between Iran and Israel that could spin out into an all-out regional war.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: What the process looks like when it comes to vetting a presidential running mate
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will be selecting her running mate soon. NPR's Michel Martin spoke with James Hamilton, who helped vet VP candidates for four democratic presidential candidates.
item.content:encoded: Vice President Kamala Harris will be selecting her running mate soon. NPR's Michel Martin spoke with James Hamilton, who helped vet VP candidates for four democratic presidential candidates.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: The U.S. wins silver in Olympic triathlon mixed relay after contesting close result
item.description: After the photo finish, Great Britain was initially awarded the silver. A review overturned that result, showing that the U.S. squeaked by to place second.
item.content:encoded:
After the photo finish, Great Britain was initially awarded the silver. A review overturned that result, showing that the U.S. squeaked by to place second.

(Image credit: Vadim Ghirda)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Hurricane Debby approaches Florida as it brings heavy rain across the Southeast
item.description: Debby is expected to move through Georgia and South Carolina after leaving Florida, according to the National Hurricane Center.
item.content:encoded:
Debby is expected to move through Georgia and South Carolina after leaving Florida, according to the National Hurricane Center.

(Image credit: NOAA/NESDIS/STAR GOES-East)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Debby, a Category 1 hurricane, nears the Florida coast
item.description: The National Hurricane Center says Debby is expected to bring hurricane force winds and a major flood threat to the southeastern United States.
item.content:encoded: The National Hurricane Center says Debby is expected to bring hurricane force winds and a major flood threat to the southeastern United States.
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: The 2nd week of the Olympic Games in Paris started with athletes making history
item.description: American Noah Lyles won gold in the hundred meter sprint by five one thousandths of a second. U.S. swimmers grabbed two gold medals and shattered two world records in the pool.
item.content:encoded: American Noah Lyles won gold in the hundred meter sprint by five one thousandths of a second. U.S. swimmers grabbed two gold medals and shattered two world records in the pool.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
